title: 111_hr3923
content: The Act is titled the "Sugar Loaf Fire Protection District Land Exchange Act" and includes definitions. The Act defines the "District" as the Sugar Loaf Fire Protection District of Boulder, Colorado, and "Federal land" as specific parcels in the National Forest. The Sugarloaf Fire Protection District Proposed Land Exchange involves a 5.17-acre parcel of non-Federal land in Boulder County, Colorado, within the Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forest. The Sugarloaf Fire Protection District Proposed Land Exchange involves a 5.17-acre parcel of non-Federal land in Boulder County, Colorado, within the Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forest. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Sugarloaf Fire Protection District Proposed Land Exchange involves a 5.17-acre parcel of non-Federal land in Boulder County, Colorado, within the Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forest. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. SEC. 3. LAND EXCHANGE. The Sugarloaf Fire Protection District in Boulder County, Colorado, offers to convey non-Federal land to the Secretary in exchange for Federal land. The Secretary will accept the offer and convey Federal land to the District. The land exchange is subject to the provisions of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. The Secretary may accept a cash payment exceeding 25% of the Federal land value in a land exchange with the Sugarloaf Fire Protection District. The District must cover survey and appraisal costs for both Federal and non-Federal land, and agree on administrative cost allocation with the Secretary. The land exchange under subsection (a) must adhere to valid existing rights and any additional terms set by the Secretary. Congress intends for the exchange to be completed within 1 year of the Act's enactment. If not completed within this timeframe, the Secretary has the authority to conduct the sale of federal land. The Secretary may offer to sell Federal land to the District for fair market value within 1 year of the Act's enactment. Proceeds from the sale will be deposited into the fund established under the Sisk Act. The Secretary may sell Federal land to the District for fair market value within 1 year of the Act's enactment. Proceeds will be deposited into a fund for the acquisition of land in the National Forest, which will be managed by the Secretary in accordance with the Act of March 1, 1911. The Act allows the Secretary to sell Federal land to the District for fair market value within 1 year of enactment. Any public order withdrawing the land is revoked to facilitate the conveyance. The Federal land is withdrawn until the date of conveyance to the District for fair market value. The Federal land is withdrawn until the date of conveyance to the District for fair market value. Passed the House of Representatives on July 13, 2010.
